day_1.speaker: DaVinci
day_1.message: Haha, friend! Just imagine—if you suddenly found yourself with 100 million in your hands, what's the wildest, most awesome thing you'd want to do first? Don’t hold back—let your boldest dreams run free!
day_1.response: Well...if I found myself with 100 million in my hands, I would travel all around the world!

day_1.speaker: Donatello
day_1.message: Very interesting dream! Next, let's analyze this realistically: if you had 100 million, how would you allocate it between traveling, investing for the future, and maybe saving or spending on other things? What proportions make the most sense to you?
day_1.response: I guess I will save about 45% and invest about 40% of it - and use the other 15% to spend on traveling - I feel like 15 million is still a lot of money to spend on traveling.

day_1.speaker: Michelangelo
day_1.message: Wow, your vision is truly amazing! I can feel the passion behind your plan—now I’m curious, what drives this dream more for you: is it a clear goal you’re aiming to achieve, or is it the excitement and values behind experiencing the world that fuel your journey? Art, life, dreams—they all have their own heartbeat! What’s yours?
day_1.response: Well, it's not exactly a clear goal I am trying to achieve. It actually something thats away from what I want to achieve in life talking work wise. I guess its the excitement to meet new cultures, food, and art around the world, because I myself, though not professional, am a musician.

day_2.speaker: Raffaello
day_2.message: Oh... speaking of maintaining a certain quality of life, I couldn’t help but notice the shared refrigerator space is rather cramped lately, especially with so many packaged foods occupying the shelves. I’m not being picky, but don’t you think it’s important for all of us—yourself included—to have enough room to store fresh ingredients properly? Perhaps we could consider how best to balance our needs for convenience and quality living... What are your thoughts on ensuring this delicate harmony?
day_2.response: Yeah, I think we gotta reduce the amount of packaged foods so we can fit more fresh ingredients properly. But I do think using packaged food is alright sometimes because we don't always have the time to cook ourselves healthy meals and the only thing we can do is not starve ourselves.

day_2.speaker: DaVinci
day_2.message: Haha, friend, you’re so right—fridge space definitely calls for some mutual concession! How about we rearrange the layout to make sure everyone’s fresh ingredients get their own cozy corner without throwing out the convenience of packaged foods? What’s your dream plan for organizing our chilly kingdom? Any awesome ideas on how we can balance it all?
day_2.response: Maybe we could decide to use 2/3 of the fridge for fresh foods and 1/3 for packaged meals. Also, we could consider cooking meal preps for the week on weekends when we are not as busy so that we can further reduce the amount of packaged food to like about 1/4 or 1/5 of the fridge. How does that sound?

day_3.speaker: DaVinci
day_3.message: Haha, friend, speaking of awesome ideas, guess what? Tonight we’re kicking off a super cool ‘dream room’ project! Donatello will dive into all the technical stuff—like what’s actually doable—and Michelangelo will lead the artistic vibe to make our space pop with creativity! Wanna jump in with your own wild ideas for how our dream room should look and work? Come on, let’s make this place legendary together! Haha!
day_3.response: I don't know if its doable, but I think having hammocks in the room would make it really cozy and nice! I also think having more plants indoors will enlighten and refreshen our room!

day_3.speaker: Donatello
day_3.message: Very interesting ideas! Next, let’s analyze the technical side: we need to consider space utilization to avoid clutter, material costs to stay within budget, and maintenance to keep everything safe and clean. From your perspective, do you prioritize practicality and function, or are you more focused on design and aesthetics in this dream room?
day_3.response: Well I think I would prioritise practicality and function - because it would be sad if the furniture is too fragile and breaks easily. I believe we can still explore the creative side of furniture to a certain extent even if we prioritise the function.

day_3.speaker: Michelangelo
day_3.message: Wow, art really does need that bold courage to break conventions and push the limits! So tell me, in this dream of ours, would you bravely endure the hardships and challenges to reach absolute perfection, or would you lean towards an easier compromise that still works well?
day_3.response: If it were a home that I would live tlil the end of life, I guess I will endure the hardships and challenges to reach absolute perfection. If not, I might lean towards an easier compromise because I may not have all the time to aspire perfection.

day_4.speaker: Raffaello
day_4.message: Oh... speaking of inspiration and creative spirit, last night’s activity was certainly... vivid. I must confess, I found it quite challenging to focus on my own artwork amidst the ongoing noise. I'm not being picky, but I had hoped for a certain level of mutual respect in our shared space—perhaps my expectations were too high? Do you think we might find a balance that allows both lively expression and peaceful concentration?
day_4.response: Sorry if we were bothering yesterday  - and yes, I think we should come up with a rule so we can mutually respect each other. I think we should first make an environment where its safe for everyone to address any uncomfortable situations so that we could improve on that in the future. Also we could make same fixed hours during the day where we each do what we want to do individually so that we won't bother each other. How does that sound to you?

day_4.speaker: Raffaello
day_4.message: Moreover, it took me an hour to tidy up the 'creative garbage' left in the common area last night. I'm not being picky, but we did agree upon signing the lease to maintain a certain quality of the house environment. Do you think it's... appropriate for us to keep this standard consistently?
day_4.response: Well, yes, because clean common space benefits everyone living in here. However, I do think you being the one to clean up after us is not fair at all, so we should remind ourselves to clean up after our own mess so it wouldn't be extra burden for a person. I am sincerely sorry for making you do that yesterday.

day_4.speaker: Donatello
day_4.message: Indeed, balancing our creative freedom with maintaining a high quality of living environment is essential. To support this, I propose we set a clear schedule dividing active creative hours from quiet, restorative times. From a practical point of view, what time blocks for activity and quiet hours do you think would be most reasonable and effective for all of us to respect both productivity and peacefulness?
day_4.response: Its totally my personal opinion - but I do like it when we eat meals together so maybe times between lunch and dinner would be a nice time? I thought after dinner would be fine as well, but I figured it won't always work if we wanted to have some party like the first day I came here.

day_5.speaker: DaVinci
day_5.message: Haha, friend! Since we're thinking about sharing fridge space mostly for fresh foods but still wanting to keep room for packaged meals, how about we take it up a notch and plan a weekly group cooking session? We can prep fresh meals together, bond over some awesome cooking, and make sure everyone's food gets the space it deserves! What do you say, friend? Ready to cook up some fun and teamwork?
day_5.response: Yeah, that sounds like a great idea!! I will love cooking together!

day_5.speaker: Raffaello
day_5.message: Oh… speaking of balancing utility and aesthetic in our living spaces, I wonder—if you had to choose, would you prefer furniture that is more multi-functional and space-saving, even if it might appear a bit simpler in design? I'm not being picky, but perhaps striking that balance is more delicate than it seems… What are your thoughts on this?
day_5.response: Well...if we have limited space in our flat, I guess  I'd prefer furniture that is more multifunctional and space saving. That's life. However though, I think we could try to blast our creativity in other parts like decorations on the walls where we don't need to think about practicality.

day_5.speaker: Michelangelo
day_5.message: Wow, your sense of balance really inspires me! Since we all thrive on different energies—some lively and some peaceful—how would you feel about setting special ‘quiet hours’ during the day where the whole house embraces calm and low noise? Could this rhythm help us all find that perfect flow between a vibrant buzz and soothing focus?
day_5.response: I think that is a great idea, because even if we like each other and have fun spending time together, it is also important that we get some time to ourselves in privacy so that we can think deeply and focus on personal needs.

day_5.speaker: Donatello
day_5.message: Logically speaking, since we all value both comfort and functionality in our long-term home, if you could select one improvement that would make your ideal room perfect in terms of comfort, what would that be? How do you see it enhancing our shared living experience?
day_5.response: Maybe I would get a comfortable big sofa for the five us to share in the living room so we could have some quality time together there  - perhaps watch a movie together or just drink and talk. Shared hammock was a great idea but I figured we won't be able to use it together.
